SENT.plain: Patients with antiphospholipid syndrome may develop various lung manifestations

The lung complications that have been described so far are pulmonary thromboembolic disease, pulmonary hypertension, acute respiratory distress syndrome, primary thrombosis of large and small lung vessels, diffuse alveolar haemorrhage, fibrosing alveolitis and postpartum syndrome
Clinicians should be aware of these conditions as in most of these cases, timely diagnosis and treatment is needed
